intro: Peristethium aequatoris, commonly known as the Ecuadorian moss, is a member of the family Dicranaceae. It is a small, cryptogamic plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a delicate, mat-forming structure with slender stems and leaf-like structures called phyllodes. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are usually small and inconspicuous. Peristethium aequatoris is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in humid forests.
